name: squirt
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I or T, usually + adv/prep ] (to force a liquid) to flow out through a narrow opening in a fast stream: He squirted some ketchup on his burger. There was a leak in one of the pipes and water was squirting out all over the kitchen floor.
[ T ] to hit someone or something with a liquid or gas: She was squirting the neighbours with a water pistol.

(LIQUID)
an amount of liquid or gas that is squirted out: The door should stop squeaking once I've given it a few squirts of oil.

squirt noun [C]

old-fashioned a young or small person who you do not consider to be important and who has behaved rudely towards you: I caught my neighbour's son writing graffiti on our wall, the little squirt.

to quickly force a liquid out of something, or of liquids to flow through a narrow opening: [ T ] Squirt lemon juice on the clams and enjoy them. [ I ] fig. The ball squirted free (= moved quickly away) and bounced out of bounds.
an amount of liquid that is forced to flow out through a narrow opening: A squirt of glue should fix it.
infml A squirt is also a small person you consider unimportant. Note: This use is usually intended to be insulting.
